DGACM.relevance_comment: Obligation: directs the Secretary-General to bring to the attention of all Council representatives communications from States or UN organs relevant to Council consideration. Connection to PPB: DGACM (through its secretariat and conference‑servicing functions) implements dissemination of such communications, agendas and meeting information (see PPB: mandate/background paras 2.1(a), and services for agendas/meeting information under subprogramme 1 and programme support).

Obligation: requires the Secretary-General to draw up the provisional agenda for each Security Council meeting (to be approved by the Council President). Connection to PPB: DGACM provides procedural secretariat support and prepares agendas and related documentation for intergovernmental bodies (PPB paras 2.1(a), subprogramme 1 activities and documentation/agenda preparation functions).

Obligation: requires the Secretary-General to communicate the provisional agenda to representatives at least three days before a meeting (or simultaneously in urgent cases). Connection to PPB: the Department is responsible for timely distribution/communication of agendas and meeting materials (documentation and conference‑management functions described across subprogrammes, notably PPB paras 2.1(a), 2.26–2.31 and subprogramme deliverables).

Obligation: directs the Secretary-General to communicate weekly to Council representatives a summary of matters before the Council and their stage. Connection to PPB: DGACM supports provision and dissemination of intergovernmental information and maintains portals and services (e‑deleGATE, iGov, Journal) used to inform Member States (PPB paras 2.20–2.23, 2.22 on iGov portal).

Obligation: requires the Secretary-General to examine credentials of representatives and submit a report to the Security Council for approval. Connection to PPB: DGACM’s Protocol and Liaison Service provides protocol support, registration and related administration for mission personnel and delegates (PPB paras 2.202 and Executive direction and management description).

Obligation: requires the Secretary-General to provide the staff required by the Security Council (part of the Secretariat). Connection to PPB: DGACM supplies procedural and technical secretariat staff for intergovernmental bodies and conference‑servicing (PPB paras 2.1(a),(c) and subprogrammes on meetings, documentation and staffing strategies).

Obligation: requires the Secretary-General to give notice of Security Council meetings to representatives. Connection to PPB: DGACM handles logistics, meeting scheduling and communications to delegations (PPB paras 2.1(a), 2.20 and subprogramme 2 planning/coordination of conference services).

Obligation: makes the Secretary-General responsible for preparation of documents required by the Security Council and for distributing them (normally) at least 48 hours in advance. Connection to PPB: DGACM’s documentation and publishing services (subprogramme 3 and 4) carry out preparation, translation, editing and timely simultaneous issuance of Security Council and other parliamentary documents (PPB paras 2.46–2.54, 2.67).

Obligation (normative rule): establishes the six official/working languages of the Council. Connection to PPB: DGACM is the Secretariat lead for multilingual conference‑servicing and Secretariat‑wide multilingualism, responsible for ensuring equal treatment of official languages across services (PPB paras 2.1(c), 2.2, 2.3 and multilingualism/coordinator responsibilities in paras 2.1 and 2.3).

Obligation: requires that speeches in any of the six languages be interpreted into the other five languages. Connection to PPB: DGACM provides interpretation services and manages interpreter resources and assignments (subprogramme 4 meetings and interpretation services, PPB paras 2.59–2.66 and duty‑station descriptions).

Obligation: sets out the arrangement when a representative speaks in a language outside the six Council languages, including that Secretariat interpreters may base interpretation on the first interpretation. Connection to PPB: DGACM supplies and manages Secretariat interpreters and related procedures (PPB paras 2.59–2.66 and protocol/interpretation responsibilities).

Obligation: requires verbatim records of Security Council meetings be drawn up in the languages of the Council. Connection to PPB: DGACM’s verbatim reporting and documentation services are responsible for producing verbatim records in the six official languages (subprogramme 4 and subprogramme 3 documentation functions; PPB paras 2.58–2.66, 2.61–2.64).

Obligation: requires that all resolutions and other documents be published in the languages of the Security Council. Connection to PPB: DGACM’s documentation and publishing services (subprogrammes 3 and 4) are responsible for translation, editing and simultaneous publication of resolutions and documents in the six official languages (PPB paras 2.46–2.54, 2.67, and publishing deliverables).

Obligation: requires that, subject to rule 51, the verbatim record of each meeting be made available to Council representatives and participating States not later than 10 a.m. of the first working day following the meeting. Connection to PPB: DGACM is responsible for rapid processing and issuance of verbatim records and managing resources to meet these timeliness requirements (PPB paras on verbatim processing and targets, e.g. 2.61–2.64).

Obligation: requires the Secretary-General to submit annually to the Security Council a list of records and documents that have been considered confidential, for the Council to decide their status. Connection to PPB: DGACM manages custody, classification and publication of Council records and implements Council decisions on confidentiality and access through its documentation and records processes (PPB paras on documentation/publishing and record management).
